title: Eagle Vs drone
text: >> Reuters   11:40:57.0   11:41:04.0 BdST France says it is ready to use a squadron of four specially trained golden eagles, besides jamming or GPS blocking equipment, to neutralise drones following recent reports that Islamic State used unmanned vehicles to scout targets or launch attacks in Iraq or Syria. A golden eagle grabs a flying drone during a military training exercise at Mont-de-Marsan French Air Force base, Southwestern France, February 10, 2017. Reuters A golden eagle grabs a flying drone during a military training exercise at Mont-de-Marsan French Air Force base. Reuters A golden eagle grabs a flying drone during a military training exercise at Mont-de-Marsan French Air Force base. Reuters A golden eagle carries a flying drone away during a military training exercise at Mont-de-Marsan French Air Force base. Reuters A golden eagle carries a flying drone away during a military training exercise at Mont-de-Marsan French Air Force base. Reuters Claws of an golden eagle are pictured as part of a military training for combat against drones in Mont-de-Marsan French Air Force base. Reuters A golden eagle is pictured as part of a military training for combat against drones in Mont-de-Marsan French Air Force base. Reuters Boxes with the names of golden eagles are pictured as part of a military training for combat against drones in Mont-de-Marsan French Air Force base. Reuters A French army falconer works with a golden eagle as part of a military training for combat against drones in Mont de Marsan French Air Force base. Reuters A French army falconer works with a golden eagle as part of a military training for combat against drones in Mont-de-Marsan French Air Force base. Reuters
